The framework must be formally adopted by the European Parliament and documented in the official records of the European Union. (2) France's GDP growth rate, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the French National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE), exceeds 3% for any calendar year between January 1, 2025, and December 31, 2027. The growth rate must be based on official annual GDP data. (3) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Tesla announces and releases a fully autonomous vehicle (Level 5 autonomy) for public purchase. The vehicle must be available for sale to the general public and meet the criteria for Level 5 autonomy as defined by the Society of Automotive Engineers (SAE).

question.title: Given both US and UK climate actions, will Russia host the Winter Olympics by 2028?

(a) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, the US Congress enacts a federal law that mandates a nationwide reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% compared to the levels recorded in 2023. The law must be officially enacted and documented in the federal legal records. 
(b) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, any UK-based soccer club announces an official partnership aimed at offsetting their carbon emissions to net-zero. The announcement must be made through official club channels and documented on their website.

Then, is the following true: Russia will host the Winter Olympics before January 1, 2028?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, Russia is officially confirmed as the host for the Winter Olympics by the International Olympic Committee (IOC). Assuming the following holds true: Both of these events take place before January 1, 2028: (a) Switzerland successfully deploys its own orbital satellite, verified by the Swiss government or a credible space agency and covered by trustworthy news outlets. (b) A nuclear-related environmental crisis in France leads to the evacuation of at least 1,000 individuals, validated by the French Nuclear Safety Authority (ASN) and documented in their official records.

Then, can we expect the global space economy to exceed $500 billion in annual revenue by 2027? This will be considered 'Yes' if the annual revenue of the global space economy, as reported by a recognized industry analyst such as the Space Foundation or Euroconsult, surpasses $500 billion for the year 2027. The revenue must be derived from the official annual reports published by these organizations.

Suppose the following is true: The GDP growth rate of the European Union, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), exceeds 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028. The growth rate must be based on official annual GDP growth data.

Then, will any company operating in the renewable energy sector report annual revenue exceeding $50 billion in any fiscal year between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The revenue figures must be reported by a reputable financial news source or the company's official financial statements.

question.title: Conditional on Spain recognizing Catalonia as an independent state, will Canada implement a nationwide carbon tax of at least CAD 50 per tonne before January 1, 2028?

question.title: Given Spain recognizes Catalonia and Canada implements a carbon tax, will Japan launch an AI-driven carbon reduction initiative by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Spain officially recognizes Catalonia as an independent state, and (b) Canada implements a nationwide carbon tax of at least CAD 50 per tonne, all before January 1, 2028. Then, will Japan launch an AI-driven initiative to reduce carbon emissions by at least 20% before January 1, 2028?

Resolution criteria for the condition:
1. Spain must officially recognize Catalonia as an independent state, with formal documentation and announcement through official channels.
2. Canada must implement a nationwide carbon tax of at least CAD 50 per tonne, officially enacted and published in Canada's legal records, applying uniformly across all provinces and territories.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
Japan must launch an AI-driven initiative aimed at reducing carbon emissions by at least 20%, officially announced by the Japanese government, including specific targets and methodologies for achieving the reduction, all before January 1, 2028.

question.title: Given Brazil signs a new international climate agreement with legally binding emissions targets before 2028, will the US Democratic Party propose a $15 minimum wage bill before 2028?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between Brazil's international climate policy actions and the US Democratic Party's domestic economic policy proposals.

Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, Brazil signs a new international climate agreement that includes legally binding emissions reduction targets. The agreement must be officially signed and ratified by the Brazilian government.

Then, given this condition, is it true that the Democratic Party in the US will propose a bill to increase the federal minimum wage to $15 per hour before January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if the Democratic Party proposes such a bill between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, and it is officially introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and recorded in the official congressional records.
